gurmukhi: ਜੳੁਨ ਮੋ ਗਰਿ ਡਾਰਿ ਗੲਿਓ ਤਿਹ ਕਾਟਿ ਹੈ ਅਹਿਰਾੲਿ ॥
transliteration: Jaoun Mo Gad(i) Daar(i) Gado Tih Kaattee Hai Ahiraae||
translation: (He said:) “He, who hath put this snake around my neck, he will be bitten by the king of snakes;

gurmukhi: ਸਪਤ ਦਿਵਸਨ ਮੈ ਮਰੈ ਯਹਿ ਸਤਿ ਸ੍ਰਾਪ ਸਦਾੲਿ ॥੬॥੧੬੨॥
transliteration: Sapat Divas An Mai Darai Yah(i) Sat(i) Sraap Sadaae||6||162||
translation: “He will die within seven days. This curse of mine will ever be rure.”6.162.

gurmukhi: ਸ੍ਰਾਪ ਕੋ ਸੁਨਿ ਕੈ ਡਰਿਓ ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਮੰਦ੍ਰ ੲੇਕ ੳੁਸਾਰ ॥
transliteration: Sraap Ko Soun(i) Kai Dario Nrip Mandra Ek Ousaar||
translation: Coming to know about the curse, the king was frightened. He got and Abode constructed.

gurmukhi: ਮਧਿ ਗੰਗ ਰਚਿਓ ਧੳੁਲਹਰਿ ਛੁੲਿ ਸਕੈ ਨ ਬਿਅਾਰ ॥
transliteration: Madh(i) Gadg Rachio Dhaulhar(i) Chhue Sakai Na Biaar||
translation: That palace was constructed within the Ganges, which could not even be touched by air;

gurmukhi: ਸਰਪ ਕੀ ਤਹ ਗੰਮਤਾ ਕੋ ਕਾਟਿ ਹੈ ਤਿਹ ਜਾੲਿ ॥
transliteration: Sarap Kit Ah Gadmtaa Ko Kaattee Hai Tih Jaae||
translation: How could the snake reach there and bite the king?

gurmukhi: ਕਾਲ ਪਾੲਿ ਕਟਯੋ ਤਬੈ ਤਹਿ ਅਾਨ ਕੈ ਅਹਿਰਾੲਿ ॥੭॥੧੬੩॥
transliteration: Kaal Paae Katyo Tabai Tah(i) Aan Kai Ahiraae||7||163||
translation: But within the due time, the king snakes came there and bit (the king).7.163.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਠ ਬਰਖ ਪ੍ਰਮਾਨ ਲੳੁ ਦੁੲਿ ਮਾਸ ਅੌ ਦਿਨ ਚਾਰ ॥
transliteration: Saath Barakh Pramaan Lau Due Maas Au Din Chaar||
translation: (The king Parikshat) ruled for sixty years, two months and four days.

gurmukhi: ਜੋਤਿ ਜੋਤਿ ਬਿਖੈ ਰਲੀ ਨ੍ਰਿਪਰਾਜ ਕੀ ਕਰਤਾਰ ॥
translation: Then the light of the soul of the king Parikshat merged in the light of the Creator.

gurmukhi: ਭੂਮਿ ਭਰਥ ਭੲੇ ਤਬੈ ਜਨਮੇਜ ਰਾਜ ਮਹਾਨ ॥
transliteration: Bhoom(i) Bharath Bhae Tabai Janmej Raaj Mahaan||
translation: Then the great king Janmeja become the Sustainer of the earth.

gurmukhi: ਸੂਰਬੀਰ ਹਠੀ ਤਪੀ ਦਸ ਚਾਰ ਚਾਰ ਨਿਧਾਨ ॥੮॥੧੬੪॥
translation: He was a great hero, headstrong, ascetic and adept in eighteen learinings.8.164.
The end of the Episode of King Parikshat.
The Rule of King Janmeja begins :

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜ ਕੋ ਗ੍ਹਿ ਪਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਜਨਮੇਜ ਰਾਜ ਮਹਾਨ ॥
transliteration: Raaj Ko Grih Paae Kai Janmej Raaj Mahaan||
translation: Born in the house of a king, the great king Jammeja;
